medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with bleeding per rectum at 1 year of age. He developed gynecomastia characterized by firm nontender breast tissue over a duration of 2.5 years, with breast tissue palpable beneath the areola, first referred for endocrine assessment at 12 years 5 months of age. Patient 2 was referred for gynecomastia at 4 years of age, with follow-up showing the condition over a 6-year period.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had gastrointestinal hamartomatous polyps and hyperpigmented macules consistent with Peutz-Jeghers syndrome (PJS). Patient 2 has a family history of PJS.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 2 has a family history of Peutz-Jeghers syndrome associated with a known STK11 mutation affecting his mother.
